pros: Working in a college environment means there are a variety of events and resources available, and a more engaging culture than a standard office. People are overall very friendly and supportive. Work-life balance is great as well as vacation time. There are lots of opportunities to interact with students in various capacities such as mentoring, internships, leading service trips, etc which can be very fulfilling if you are interested in student development.
cons: Compensation is on the low side, although vacation time and other benefits help offset that. Some decisions by administration have caused division lately, although Gordon is a diverse community that is larger than any one viewpoint.

pros: Vacation is excellent. 20 days to start, 10 sick days, week off between Christmas and New Years, 2 personal days, and something like 13 paid holidays. Insane amount of vacation. As in, too much time off to know what to do with. There are also some real gems of people working there, but each seems to be slowly departing.
cons: Gordon hasn't yet learned that you don't get top talent for bottom dollar. Salaries are horrendous, and raises are unheard of, even for performing well. Employees join for the mission of the college, and either stay and become complacent in their work because the college has no way to motivate employees, or they leave because their value isn't recognized. Leadership is tone deaf to the changing student demographics and not at all proactive about addressing problems like retention, cost of tuition, and  the relationship with the alumni network. Their approach to staff development and hiring is far from strategic, and there is a lot of dead weight that holds back progress for the school, but, again, the leadership team is not proactive to address these staffing problems, which exacerbates the issue and leads to broader layoffs for financial purposes, rather than for performance purposes.

pros: great community, real sense of helping each other and building each other up, christian atmosphere-- not cut throat like a lot of college staffs. real sense of nurturing younger employees and growing them. Vacation time is a great perk also... seems you always have more than you need
cons: lots of division between faculty, staff and students right now. can sometimes make the environment tense. (this due to recent media attention around religious freedoms and an attention hungry professor not willing to accept blame for blatantly disobeying college rules that she'd already agreed to)

pros: Rewarding work and company mission, supportive co-workers really care about each other, great perks such as free classes and gym membership and your kids can go there, no charge on tuition.
cons: Pay is no where near competitive and often advancement opportunities are filled from outside instead of promotions from within.  I have been working here for over 10 years and still make within 3k of my original starting salary despite consistently high performance reviews.

pros: Great community, good benefits, very understanding of family life, beautiful campus, free gym and discount meal plan, great coworkers, paid Christmas week off
cons: does not pay industry standards, did not do a good job listening to the "individual contributors" when making the big decisions, no consistency in benefits from one employee to another (ie, maternity leave)

review_title: Great place to get started or to invest your career into.
pros: Great benefits and very flexible working hours. On top of that the staff are generally very pleasant to work with.
cons: The pay is very low. They make up for it in benefits, but do not expect a high salary. Also, raises are not performance based, you pretty much get a CoL increase once a year.

review_title: Good Benifits for Student Workers, Full time Compensation Lacking
job_title: Client Service Representative in Wenham, MA
pros: As a student at Gordon College the enviroment is wonderful to work in and help pay off some of those student loans. Bosses are very flexible and will work with you to get you as many hours as you need.
cons: Many full time staff possisions outside of the administrative roles have very low  compensation for the amount of hours given to the institution.

pros: My supervisors and colleagues were very helpful and pleasant to work with. I always knew what was expected of me and was trained when a new task was introduced.
cons: I worked as a student, some times it was difficult to complete the tasks that were mandated of me and I had to deal with input from multiple people above me which could be confusing.

review_title: Great place to work, compensation inadequate
pros: Great staff and faculty community, wonderful student culture, autonomy, location is beautiful, staff development opportunities are frequent and high quality.
cons: Given the cost of living, compensation is not adequate to support a lower middle class lifestyle on a single income from Gordon College.
